roleset.name: to understand incorrectly, misinterpretation, misconception

role.descr: specific aspect/domain of arg1 that is being misunderstood

example.name: transitive
example.text: [*] Misunderstanding conversations with us , Mr. Tomsho argued that Mr. Redford 's environmental views are at odds with Utah residents .

example.name: adjective example
example.text: Change is never fun, especially when it could be confusing and misunderstood.

example.name: args 1 and 2
example.text: The attraction of Hegel's system for Left and Right thinkers has contributed to its misunderstanding as a philosophical project,

example.name: with args 1 and 3
example.text: Akin has a fundamental scientific misunderstanding of what the morning-after pill actually does.
example.arg: of what the morning-after pill actually does.

roleset.note: MISUNDERSTAND-V NOTES: Frames file for 'misunderstand' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from misunderstand.01-v predicate notes)
MISUNDERSTANDING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, 'misunderstand-v.01', 'understanding.01'. Corresponds to VNcls comprehend-87.2. (from misunderstanding.01-n)
MISUNDERSTOOD-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from misunderstood.01-j)
Arg3 added due to its presence in nominal usage. (from misunderstanding.01-n)
